column4: anyone know any Australian FTP servers with Ubuntu 7.04 Desktop x86 on them?
i believe netspace has it on it
ftp.netspace.net.au
netspace is showing connection errors
i just logged in then try ftp://ftp.netspace.net.au/pub/ubuntu
did that work?
works in Firefox but not my FTP client (Finder/cyberduck)
probably just need a different FTP client
you could use the default ftpclient from the terminal if that would help. just open an terminal and type: ftp ftp.netspace.net.au/pub/ubuntu
tried it in FTP and got an error 'no address associated with nodename'
try 'ftp 203.10.110.104' and login as anonymous
your using xp at the currently?
I have both a Mac and a Vista PC
you could still download it using firefox? or is that a problem, or do you need to download it in chunks?
Firefox is breaking on me ATM
can you use your mac now? it's terminal is more like ubuntu, I haven't used vista so i'm not sure of its finer points :)
ls
and if you want to download a file . nav to the dir and then use 'get %FILENAME'
it will download it to the directory you started ftp from. which would most prob be your home directory
we got a download going =D
you can change the download directory with 'lcd' which is local change dir :)
yeah it feels a bit backwards with our speeds out here. who are you connected with?
